Create sources data object in same format as observations

geoDataSource.Rd

Simple function that ensures that sources are in the correct format required by Rgeoprofile. Takes longitude and latitude as input vectors and returns these same values in list format. If no values are input then default values are used.

geoDataSource(longitude = NULL, latitude = NULL)

Arguments

longitude

the locations of the potential sources in degrees longitude.
latitude

the locations of the potential sources in degrees latitude.

Examples

# John Snow cholera data
geoDataSource(WaterPumps$longitude, WaterPumps$latitude)

#> $longitude
#>  [1] -0.139678 -0.139583 -0.136670 -0.139656 -0.138266 -0.135990 -0.133641
#>  [8] -0.131694 -0.139649 -0.137783 -0.135909 -0.134724 -0.134102
#> 
#> $latitude
#>  [1] 51.51486 51.51382 51.51327 51.51007 51.51119 51.51142 51.51202 51.51223
#>  [9] 51.51634 51.51662 51.51605 51.51624 51.50995
#> 

# simulated data
sim <-rDPM(50, priorMean_longitude = -0.04217491, priorMean_latitude = 
51.5235505, alpha=1, sigma=1, tau=3)
geoDataSource(sim$longitude, sim$latitude)

#> $longitude
#>  [1] -0.029846510 -0.022355893 -0.046943191 -0.018294959 -0.026393270
#>  [6] -0.021512941 -0.054118122 -0.031142845 -0.037608642 -0.112580396
#> [11] -0.111855147 -0.112512923 -0.110434773 -0.118377447 -0.110007153
#> [16] -0.107715154 -0.119158450 -0.118403872 -0.137925202 -0.114840540
#> [21] -0.132466974 -0.111015338 -0.127540469 -0.134437704 -0.029566663
#> [26] -0.049939706 -0.055667819 -0.052709048 -0.025781578 -0.028267914
#> [31] -0.028683632 -0.036947733 -0.020282562 -0.042947639 -0.029982339
#> [36] -0.039208378 -0.040212295 -0.050733174 -0.017120110 -0.040075235

#> [46] -0.009859465 -0.006497051  0.006335018 -0.026988909 -0.003374440
#>
